attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. If tails, this attack does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Take Away
attacks.text: Shuffle Erika's Dragonair and all cards attached to it into your deck. Then, your opponent shuffles his or her Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Repeating Drill
attacks.text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Take up to 2 Lightning Energy cards from your discard pile and attach them to Lt. Surge's Electabuzz.

attacks.name: Discharge
attacks.text: Discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Lt. Surge's Electabuzz in order to use this attack. Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Lightning Energy cards you discarded. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Knockout Needle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 60 more damage. If 1 or both of them are tails, this attack does 30 damage.

attacks.name: Crosscounter
attacks.text: If an attack does damage to Rocket's Hitmonchan during your opponent's next turn (even if Rocket's Hitmonchan is Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads, Rocket's Hitmonchan attacks your opponent's Active Pokémon for double that amount of damage. (If Rocket's Hitmonchan takes 20 damage, it does 40 damage to that Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Rebirth
abilities.text: When Rocket's Moltres is Knocked Out, you may return it to your hand after discarding it. This power can't be used if Rocket's Moltres is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed when it is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Fire Wall
attacks.text: If an attack does damage to Rocket's Moltres during your opponent's next turn (even if Rocket's Moltres is Knocked Out), Rocket's Moltres attacks your opponent's Active Pokémon for 10 damage. (Apply Weakness and Resistance.)

abilities.name: Energy Charge
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), if Lt. Surge's Magneton is your Active Pokémon, you may take 1 Lightning Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon and attach it to Lt. Surge's Magneton. This power can't be used if Lt. Surge's Magneton is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mega Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Lt. Surge's Magneton does 20 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Flee
abilities.text: If an attack does damage to Misty's Tentacruel while it's your Active Pokémon, you may switch it with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, which prevents all other effects of that attack on Misty's Tentacruel. This power can't be used if Misty's Tentacruel is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Jellyfish Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Shadow Images
attacks.text: Whenever Rocket's Scyther is attacked, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does no damage to Rocket's Scyther. (Any other effects of the attack still happen.) This effect lasts until Rocket's Scyther takes damage (or is Benched or is evolved).

attacks.name: Pain Amplifier
attacks.text: Put a damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon has already has any damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Call of the Night
attacks.text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, your opponent shuffles his or her Active Pokémon and all cards attached to it into his or her deck.

name: Erika
rules: You may draw up to 3 cards, then your opponent may draw up to 3 cards.

name: Brock
rules: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

name: Lt. Surge
rules: You can play this card only if you have at least 1 Basic Pokémon card in your hand. Put a Basic Pokémon card from your hand into play as your Active Pokémon. Put your old Active Pokémon onto your Bench. (You can't play this card if your Bench is full.)

name: Misty
rules: Discard 2 of the other cards in your hand in order to play this card. If this turn's attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), and if the attacking Pokémon has Misty in its name, the attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

name: The Rocket's Trap
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, choose up to 3 cards at random from your opponent's hand (don't look at them). Your opponent shuffles those cards into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Needles
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sandstorm
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Rock Slide
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose up to 3 of them. This attack does 10 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Bind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Tunneling
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose up to 2 of them. This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Brock's Onix can't attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Horn Toss
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Brock's Rhyhorn does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Moonwatching
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Comet Slap
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Alert
attacks.text: Draw a card. Then, switch Brock's Zubat with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. You can't use this attack if your Bench is empty.

abilities.name: Fragrance Trap
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Erika's Victreebel is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Horn Hazard
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Lt. Surge's Raichu in order to use this attack.

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.text: You may reduce all damage done by attacks to Misty's Cloyster by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (Any other effects of attacks still happen). This power can't be used if Misty's Cloyster is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Triple Cannon
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Take up to 2 Lightning Energy cards from your discard pile and attach them to Lt. Surge's Electabuzz.

attacks.name: Electric Current
attacks.text: Take 1 Lightning Energy card attached to Lt. Surge's Electabuzz and attach it to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you have no Benched Pokémon, discard that Energy card.

attacks.name: Healing Pollen
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon. If a Pokémon has fewer damage counters than the number of heads, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Sonic Distortion
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If 1 or both of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Restless Sleep
abilities.text: If your opponent's attack does damage to Rocket's Snorlax and Rocket's Snorlax is already Asleep (even if it's Knocked Out), this power does 20 damage to the attacking Pokémon.

attacks.name: Collapse
attacks.text: Rocket's Snorlax is now Asleep (after doing damage).

attacks.name: Water Ring
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon that isn't Water on each player's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Mysterious Light
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Jellyfish Pod
attacks.text: Search your deck for any number of Pokémon named Tentacool, Tentacruel, Misty's Tentacool, and/or Misty's Tentacruel. Show those cards to your opponent, then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Child's Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: One-Two Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage.

attacks.name: Shake
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Fire Tackle
attacks.text: Blaine's Growlithe does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Lucky Shot
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) This attack can't be used if your opponent has no Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Lava Burst
attacks.text: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck. (If there are fewer than 5 cards in your deck, discard all of them.) This attack does 20 damage for each Fire Energy card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Spiral Dive
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

attacks.name: Rock Toss
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Strange Barrier
abilities.text: Whenever an attack by a Basic Pokémon (including your own) does 20 or more damage to Erika's Dratini (after applying Weakness and Resistance), reduce that damage to 10. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Erika's Dratini is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Tail Strike
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Deflector
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, whenever Erika's Exeggcute takes damage, divide that damage in half (rounded down to the nearest 10). (Any other effects still happen.)

attacks.name: Egg Bomb
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing to the Defending Pokémon and Erika's Exeggcute does 20 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Photosynthesis
abilities.text: All Energy cards attached to Erika's Oddish provide Grass Energy instead of their usual type. This power works even while Erika's Oddish is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Psychic Exchange
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 5 cards.

attacks.name: Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 30 damage.

attacks.name: Healing Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 4 damage counters from Erika's Gloom. If Erika's Gloom has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Magic Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned (your choice).

attacks.name: Dream Dance
attacks.text: Both the Defending Pokémon and Erika's Gloom are now Asleep (after doing damage).

attacks.name: Vile Smell
attacks.text: Both the Defending Pokémon and Erika's Gloom are now Confused (after doing damage).

attacks.name: Flytrap
attacks.text: Before doing damage, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with his or her Active Pokémon. This attack can't be used if your opponent has no Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sleep Poison
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Mud Splash
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Misty's Starmie but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

attacks.name: Bubblebeam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Removal Pulse
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of those Energy cards and discard it.

attacks.name: Confusion Pulse
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Super Fang
attacks.text: Does damage to the Defending Pokémon equal to half the Defending Pokémon's remaining HP (rounded up to the nearest 10).

attacks.name: Rapids
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of those Energy cards and discard it.

attacks.name: Water Punch
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Water Energy attached to Misty's Poliwhirl. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Call for Friend
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may search your deck for a Basic Pokémon with Misty in its name and put it onto your Bench. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Good Night
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Good Morning
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon was Asleep, it is no longer Asleep.

attacks.name: Night Spirits
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the total number of Sabrina's Gastlys, Sabrina's Haunters, and Sabrina's Gengars you have in play. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Naptime
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 3 damage counters from Sabrina's Slowbro and Sabrina's Slowbro is now Asleep. If Sabrina's Slowbro has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

attacks.name: Screaming Headbutt
attacks.text: You can't use this attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Crystal Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't attach Energy cards to the Defending Pokémon during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Kindle
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Blaine's Charmander in order to use this attack. If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, choose 1 of them and discard it.

attacks.name: Blaze
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Grass Pokémon on your opponent's Bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: 3-Pronged Tail
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Full Speed Charge
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads to the Defending Pokémon and 20 damage times the number of tails to Blaine's Tauros.

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Blaine's Ponyta.

attacks.name: Taunt
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Call for Friend
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may search your deck for a Basic Pokémon card with Brock in its name and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. (You can't use this attack if your Bench is full.)

attacks.name: Hook Shot
attacks.text: Don't apply Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Resistance still happen.)

abilities.name: Natural Healing
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may remove 1 damage counter from Blaine's Vulpix. This power can't be used if Blaine's Vulpix is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Tail Fan
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Drill Tackle
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If 1 or both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Bellow
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fidget
attacks.text: Shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Karate Chop
attacks.text: Does 40 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Brock's Mankey.

attacks.name: Defense Curl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Brock's Sandshrew during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

attacks.name: Poison Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sand Pit
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Poison Vine
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Careless Tackle
attacks.text: Erika's Bellsprout does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Blot
attacks.text: If there are any damage counters on Erika's Oddish, remove 1 of them.

attacks.name: Sporadic Sponging
attacks.text: If Erika's Oddish has any damage counters on it, flip a coin. If heads, remove 1 of those damage counters.

attacks.name: Eggsplosion
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Energy attached to Erika's Exeggcute. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Stretch Vine
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Razor Wind
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Spin Ball
attacks.text: Flip 1 coin. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Take 1 Lightning Energy card from your discard pile and attach it to Lt. Surge's Pikachu.

attacks.name: Lightning Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, Lt. Surge's Rattata's Gnaw attack's base damage is doubled.

attacks.name: Fury Attack
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Stare
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Clamp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

attacks.name: Spook
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Energy Loop
attacks.text: Return a Psychic Energy card attached to Sabrina's Abra to your hand in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Suggestion
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokémon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sleight of Hand
attacks.text: Choose up to 3 cards from your hand and put them on top of your deck. Then search your deck for that many basic Energy cards. Show those cards to your opponent, then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Poison Antennae
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Removal Beam
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Energy cards attached to it, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of those Energy cards and discard it.

attacks.name: Lazy Attack
attacks.text: Sabrina's Slowpoke is now Asleep (after doing damage).

name: Brock
rules: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

name: Charity
rules: Attach Charity to your Active Pokémon. Unless that Pokémon gets Knocked Out, return Charity to your hand at the end of your turn. If that Pokémon attacks and does damage to the Defending Pokémon, you may reduce that damage by any amount (rounded to the nearest 10).

name: Blaine's Quiz #1
rules: Put a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card from your hand face down in front of you and tell your opponent its name. Your opponent guesses the length of that Pokémon. Flip the card over. If your opponent guessed right, he or she draws 2 cards. If your opponent guessed wrong, you draw 2 cards. Either way, return the card to your hand.

name: Erika
rules: You may draw up to 3 cards, then your opponent may draw up to 3 cards.

name: Brock's Training Method
rules: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card with Brock in its name. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Lt. Surge
rules: You can play this card only if you have at least 1 Basic Pokémon card in your hand. Put a Basic Pokémon card from your hand into play as your Active Pokémon. Put your old Active Pokémon onto your Bench. (You can't play this card if your Bench is full.)

name: Misty
rules: Discard 2 of the other cards in your hand in order to play this card. If this turn's attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), and if the attacking Pokémon has Misty in its name, the attack does 20 more damage to the Defending Pokémon.

name: No Removal Gym
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
A player must discard 2 cards from his or her hand in order to play an Energy Removal or Super Energy Removal card.

name: The Rocket's Training Gym
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Each player pays Colorless more to retreat his or her Active Pokémon.

name: Blaine's Last Resort
rules: You can't play this card if you have any cards in your hand other than Blaine's Last Resort. Show your hand to your opponent, then draw 5 cards.

name: Pewter City Gym
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Don't apply Resistance to any attacks made by Pokémon with Brock in their names.

name: Erika's Maids
rules: Trade 2 of the other cards in your hand for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and/or Evolution cards with Erika in their names from your deck. Show those cards to your opponent, then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Cerulean City Gym
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Each player pays Colorless less to retreat his or her Pokémon if it has Misty in its name.

name: Erika's Perfume
rules: Look at your opponent's hand. If he or she has any Basic Pokémon cards there, you may put any number of them onto your opponent's Bench (as long as there's room).

name: Lt. Surge's Treaty
rules: Your opponent chooses 1 of the following: everyone chooses 1 of his or her own Prizes and put it into his or her hand, or you draw a card.

name: Misty's Wrath
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. Choose 2 of those cards and put them into your hand. Discard the rest.

name: Celadon City Gym
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.

During each player's turn, that player may choose to discard an Energy card attached to 1 of his or her Pokémon with Erika in its name. If that player does so, that Pokémon is no longer Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, or Poisoned.

name: Good Manners
rules: In order to play this card, you can't have any Basic Pokémon cards in your hand. Show your hand to your opponent, then search your deck for a Basic Pokémon card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Minion of Team Rocket
rules: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and return it and all cards attached to it to his or her hand. If 1 or both of them are tails, your turn ends immediately (you can't attack this turn).

name: Recall
rules: For your attack this turn, your Active Pokémon can use any attack from its Basic Pokémon card or any Evolution card attached to it. (You still have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.)

name: Sabrina's ESP
rules: Attach Sabrina's ESP to 1 of your Pokémon with Sabrina in its name. At the end of your turn, discard Sabrina's ESP. If that Pokémon uses and attack that involves flipping coins, Sabrina's ESP lets you re-flip those coins once. If you do, re-flip all the coins.

name: Secret Mission
rules: Look at your opponent's hand. Then, you may discard as many other cards as you want from your hand and draw that many cards.

name: Tickling Machine
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent sets aside all the cards in his or her hand face down. Nobody may look at those cards. At the end of your opponent's next turn, your opponent puts those cards back into his or her hand. If tails, your turn ends immediately (you can't attack this turn).

name: Vermilion City Gym
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.

Whenever a player attacks with a Pokémon with Lt. Surge in its name, he or she may flip a coin. If heads, and if that Pokémon's attack does damage to the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack does 10 more damage to the Defending Pokémon. If tails, the attacking Pokémon does 10 damage to itself in addition to whatever its attack usually does.

name: Misty's Duel
rules: You and your opponent play a game of Rock-Paper-Scissors. The winner shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws a new hand of 5 cards. (If you don't know how to play Rock-Paper-Scissors, flip a coin to decide who's the winner.)

name: Sabrina's Gaze
rules: Each player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws a new hand of the same number of cards.

name: Energy Flow
rules: For each of your Pokémon, you may return any number of Energy cards attached to it to your hand.

name: Blaine's Gamble
rules: Discard any number of other cards from your hand, then flip a coin. If heads, draw twice that many cards.

name: Narrow Gym
rules: This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.

No player may have more than 4 Pokémon on his or her Bench. When this card is played, if a player has 5 Pokémon on his or her Bench, that player chooses 1 of them and returns it and all cards attached to it to his or her hand. (If both players have to return a Pokémon, your opponent returns a Pokémon first.)

name: Trash Exchange
rules: Count the number of cards in your discard pile and shuffle them into your deck. Then discard that many cards from the top of your deck.

attacks.name: Heat Tackle
attacks.text: Blaine's Arcanine does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Firestorm
attacks.text: Discard 3 Fire Energy cards attached to Blaine's Arcanine in order to use this attack.

attacks.name: Roaring Flames
attacks.text: Discard all Fire Energy cards attached to Blaine's Charizard. If all Energy cards attached to Blaine's Charizard provide 2 Fire Energy, discard all of them. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each Fire Energy discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Flame Jet
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

abilities.name: Shapeshift
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may attach an Evolution card from your hand to Brock's Ninetales. (This doesn't count as evolving Brock's Ninetales.) Treat Brock's Ninetales as if it were that Pokémon instead. It can't evolve, devolve, or use the Pokémon Power of that Pokémon. During your turn, you may discard the Evolution card attached to Brock's Ninetales. This power can't be used if Brock's Ninetales is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed. If Brock's Ninetales becomes Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed, discard all Evolution cards attached to it.

attacks.name: Growth
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may attach up to 2 Grass Energy cards from your hand to Erika's Venusaur.

attacks.name: Wide Solarbeam
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 2 of them (or 1 if he or she only has 1). This attack does 20 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Summon Storm
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, this attack does 20 damage to each other Pokémon (even your own). Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack.

attacks.name: Dragon Tornado
attacks.text: Unless this attack Knocks Out the Defending Pokémon, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Fortitude
abilities.text: If Giovanni's Machamp would be Knocked Out by an opponent's attack, flip a coin. If heads, Giovanni's Machamp is not Knocked Out and its remaining HP become 10 instead. This power can't be used if Giovanni's Machamp is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hurricane Punch
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Nerve Poison
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Hyper Needle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. Either way, you can't use this attack again as long as Koga's Beedrill stays in play (even putting Koga's Beedrill on the Bench won't let you use it again).

abilities.name: Call the Boss
abilities.text: When you play Giovanni's Persian from your hand, you may search your deck for the Trainer card named Giovanni, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Intimidate
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon's maximum HP is 50 or less, it can't attack Giovanni's Nidoking during your opponent's next turn. (Benching or evolving either Pokémon ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Tumbling Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage; if tails, this attack does 40 damage.

attacks.name: Kerzap
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage to the Defending Pokémon and discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Lt. Surge's Raichu. If tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Thundertackle
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, Lt. Surge's Raichu does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Electro Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Energy cards attached to Misty's Golduck.

attacks.name: Super Removal
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Energy card attached to each of your opponent's Pokémon that has any Energy cards and discard those Energy cards.

abilities.name: Rebellion
abilities.text: Whenever Misty's Gyarados attacks, flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, that attack does nothing. Instead, shuffle Misty's Gyarados and all cards attached to it into your deck. (This power works even if Misty's Gyarados is Confused.)

attacks.name: Giant Growth
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, Koga's Ditto's maximum HP is now 80 and Koga's Ditto's Pound attack's base damage is 30 instead of 10. (Benching Koga's Ditto ends this effect.)

attacks.name: Juxtapose
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch the number of damage counters on Rocket's Mewtwo with the number of damage counters on the Defending Pokémon (even if it would Knock Out either Pokémon). (It's okay if 1 of the Pokémon has no damage counters on it.)

attacks.name: Hypnoblast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: If there are any Lightning Energy cards in your discard pile, attach 1 of them to Rocket's Zapdos.

attacks.name: Electroburn
attacks.text: Rocket's Zapdos does damage to itself equal to 10 times the number of Lightning Energy cards attached to it.

name: Giovanni
rules: Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play with Giovanni in its name. For the rest of your turn, you may evolve that Pokémon even if you just played or evolved it this turn or if this is your first turn. This effect also applies to the Pokémon it evolves into.

name: Blaine
rules: During this turn, instead of attaching your free Energy card, you may instead attach 2 Fire Energy cards to 1 of your Pokémon with Blaine in its name. (Playing additional copies of this card this turn has no effect.)

abilities.name: Psylink
abilities.text: Sabrina's Alakazam always has a copy of every attack your Psychic Pokémon in play have (including their Energy costs and anything else required in order to use those attacks, such as discarding Energy cards). This power can't be used if Sabrina's Alakazam is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mega Burn
attacks.text: You can't use this attack during your next turn.

name: Sabrina
rules: Take all Energy cards attached to 1 of your Pokémon with Sabrina in its name and attach them to another 1 of your Pokémon with Sabrina in its name.

name: Koga
rules: If an attack from a Pokémon with Koga in its name does damage to a Defending Pokémon this turn, that Pokémon is then Poisoned.

attacks.name: Lie Low
attacks.text: All damage done to Brock's Dugtrio during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Earthdrill
attacks.text: This attack can't be used unless Brock's Dugtrio used its Lie Low attack last turn.

abilities.name: Healing Fire
abilities.text: Whenever you attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to Blaine's Ninetales, remove 1 damage counter from it, if it has any. This power stops working when Blaine's Ninetales is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Burn Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Fire Energy cards attached to Blaine's Ninetales.

attacks.name: Love Lariat
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 50 more damage if you have at least 1 Giovanni's Nidoking on your Bench. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Poison Buildup
attacks.text: Koga's Arbok is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Poison Power
attacks.text: If Koga's Arbok is Poisoned, this attack's base damage is 40 instead of 20 and the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Snapping Pincers
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Overhead Toss
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If tails, choose 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Energy Drain
abilities.text: If an opponent's attack does damage to Koga's Muk (even if Koga's Muk is Knocked Out), flip a coin. If heads and if it has any, choose 1 Energy card attached to the attacking Pokémon and discard it. This power can't be used if Koga's Muk is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed when your opponent attacks.

attacks.name: High Voltage
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent can't play Trainer cards during his or her next turn.

attacks.name: Thunder Flare
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Lt. Surge's Jolteon, then flip a coin. If tails, Lt. Surge's Jolteon does 30 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Quick Turn
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Aerial Maneuvers
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage, and, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Koga's Pidgeotto. If tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Dark Wave
attacks.text: All Pokémon Powers stop working until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Shadow Bind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Damage Shift
attacks.text: Move 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon that has any on it to the Defending Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.)

attacks.name: Water Spray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Bonfire
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, discard 1 Fire Energy card attached to Blaine's Charmeleon. If you can't discard Energy cards, this attack does nothing. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads to each of your opponent's Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Mega Peck
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Detonate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Pokémon on each player's bench. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Brock's Graveler does 50 damage to itself. If there is a Stadium card in play, discard it.

abilities.name: Scram
abilities.text: If Brock's Primeape ever has exactly 10 HP left, shuffle it and all cards attached to it into your deck. This power stops working while Brock's Primeape is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Mega Thrash
attacks.text: Brock's Primeape does 20 damage to itself. If there is a Stadium card in play, discard it.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Pokémon Powers, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Needle Ball
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Stamp
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage (to the Defending Pokémon) and 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) If tails, this attack does 30 damage (to the Defending Pokémon).

attacks.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Fire Ring
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Soak Up
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may take up to 2 Grass Energy cards attached to your other Pokémon and attach them to Erika's Bellsprout. This power can't be used if Erika's Bellsprout is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Stretch Vine
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Sleep Seed
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Errand-Running
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, you may search your deck for a Trainer card. Show it to your opponent and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Risky Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does no damage to the Defending Pokémon and Giovanni's Machoke does 100 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Headlock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: False Charity
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, look at the top card of your opponent's deck. If it's a Trainer card, put it in your opponent's discard pile; otherwise, put it into his or her hand.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Lunar Power
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Benched Pokémon and put that card on that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

abilities.name: Relaxing Scent
abilities.text: As long as Erika's Ivysaur is your Active Pokémon, whenever an attack (even your own) does damage to any Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), that attack only does half the damage to that Pokémon (rounded up to the nearest 10). (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power stops working while Erika's Ivysaur is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Double Razor Leaf
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Poison Sting Tackle
attacks.text: Giovanni's Nidorina does 20 damage to itself. Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage. If not, this attack does 20 damage.

attacks.name: Sonic Scream
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

abilities.name: Emerge
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for an Evolution card named Koga's Beedrill and put it on Koga's Kakuna. (This counts as evolving Koga's Kakuna.) Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Koga's Kakuna is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Toxic Secretion
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

attacks.name: Smokescreen
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Obscuring Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, shuffle Koga's Koffing and all cards attached to it into your deck (after doing damage).

attacks.name: Messenger
attacks.text: Put Koga's Pidgey and all cards attached to it on top of your deck. Then search your deck for any Basic Pokémon or Evolution card not named Koga's Pidgey. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Spontaneous Explosion
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage and Koga's Weezing does 30 damage to itself; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Toxic Cloud
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. It now takes 20 Poison damage instead of 10 after each player's turn (even if it was already Poisoned).

attacks.name: Surprise
attacks.text: Look at a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent shuffles that card into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, Lt. Surge's Raticate's Double-edge attack's damage (base damage and damage to itself) is doubled.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Lt. Surge's Raticate does 20 damage to itself.

abilities.name: Shock Blast
abilities.text: If Lt. Surge's Electrode is your Active Pokémon and gets damaged (even if it's Knocked Out), flip a coin. If tails, this power does 20 damage to each Active Pokémon. This power works even if Lt. Surge's Electrode is already Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed when it takes damage.

attacks.name: Power Ball
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

attacks.name: Invigorate
attacks.text: Choose 1 Basic Pokémon in any player's discard pile. Put it onto that player's Bench. Put a number of damage counters on that Pokémon equal to half its HP (rounded down to the nearest 10). (You can't put a Pokémon on a Bench that's full.)

attacks.name: Pendulum Curse
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Life Drain
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put a number of damage counters on the Defending Pokémon so that its remaining HP are 10.

attacks.name: Nightmare
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Shadow Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 30 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Ice Throw
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Fighting, this attack's base damage is doubled.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Misty's Dewgong does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Helping Hand
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Remove any number of damage counters from that Pokémon, then draw that many cards.

attacks.name: Hug
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Magic Darts
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon and flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack.

attacks.name: Wild Kick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Blaine's Doduo.

attacks.name: Fire Tail Slap
attacks.text: Use this attack only if there are any Fire Energy cards attached to Blaine's Charmander. Flip a coin. If tails, discard 1 of those cards.

attacks.name: Stoke
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Fire Energy card and attach it to Blaine's Growlithe. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Pranks
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a card from your opponent's discard pile and put it on top of his or her deck.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Horn Charge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads and if your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, choose 1 of them and this attack does 20 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Hind Kick
attacks.text: If you have any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, switch Blaine's Ponyta with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Tremor
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your own Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Call Will-o'-the-wisp
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, if you have a Fire Energy card in your discard pile, put it into your hand.

attacks.name: Rock Toss
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Group Therapy
attacks.text: You and your opponent remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon with damage counters on them.

attacks.name: Pulled Punch
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has no damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage. If it has any damage counters on it, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Poison Spore
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and this attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Ancestral Memory
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing. Either way, you can't use this attack again as long as Giovanni's Magikarp stays in play (even putting Giovanni's Magikarp on the Bench won't let you use it again).

attacks.name: Flail Around
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Strange Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused; if tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Fury Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on Giovanni's Machop.

attacks.name: Cat Fleas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Horn Thrust
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Double-edge
attacks.text: Giovanni's Nidoran ♀ does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Retaliation
attacks.text: You can't use this attack unless Giovanni's Nidoran ♂ has 2 or more damage counters on it.

attacks.name: Fast-Acting Poison
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both are heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sludge Grip
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sand-attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Sleep Powder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Grasping Vine
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Sharp Stinger
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned; if tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Smelly Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (including your own). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Group Attack
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of Koga's Zubats you have in play. Before doing damage, you may search your deck for any number of Basic Pokémon named Koga's Zubat and put them onto your Bench. (You can't get more cards with this attack than you have room on your Bench.) If you do, shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Focus Energy
attacks.text: During your next turn, Lt. Surge's Rattata's Quick Attack's base damage is doubled.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Bouncing Ball
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Lt. Surge's Voltorb does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Ink Spurt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, whenever the Defending Pokémon tries to attack, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing. (This effect lasts until the Defending Pokémon evolves or is Benched.)

attacks.name: Play Dead
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Misty's Magikarp.

attacks.name: Bubbles
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, you can't use this attack during your next turn.

attacks.name: Amnesia
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: ESP
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. If exactly 1 is heads, draw a card. If exactly 2 are heads, this attack does 20 damage. If all 3 are heads, choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attacks. Misty's Psyduck copies that attack except for its Energy costs. (No matter what type the Defending Pokémon is, Misty's Psyduck's type is still Water.)

attacks.name: Frostbite
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Mirage
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Synchronize
attacks.text: This attack can't be used unless Sabrina's Abra and the Defending Pokémon have the same number of Energy cards attached to them.

attacks.name: Psyscan
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

attacks.name: Star Boomerang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, return Misty's Staryu and all cards attached to it to your hand. (Either way, this attack does its damage.)

attacks.name: Energy Support
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Psychic Energy card. Show that card to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for this attack. (Any other effects that would happen after applying Weakness and Resistance still happen.)

attacks.name: Lick
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fade Out
attacks.text: Return Sabrina's Gastly and all Energy cards attached to it to your hand. (Discard all other cards attached to Sabrina's Gastly.)

abilities.name: Gaseous Form
abilities.text: Sabrina's Gastly gets +10 HP for each Psychic Energy card attached to it. This power works even if Sabrina's Gastly is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

name: Brock's Protection
rules: Attach Brock's Protection to 1 of your Pokémon with Brock in its name. Energy cards attached to that Pokémon can't be removed by your opponent's attacks or Trainer cards. (This doesn't stop the rest of the attack or Trainer card from working normally.)

name: Erika's Kindness
rules: Remove 2 damage counters from each Pokémon (yours and your opponent's) with any damage counters on it. If a Pokémon has just 1 damage counter, remove it.

name: Blaine
rules: During this turn, instead of attaching your free Energy card, you may instead attach 2 Fire Energy cards to 1 of your Pokémon with Blaine in its name. (Playing additional copies of this card this turn has no effect.)

attacks.name: Barrier Attack
attacks.text: All damage done by attacks to Sabrina's Porygon during your opponent's next turn is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Random ESP
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, this attack does no damage and Sabrina's Psyduck is now Confused.

name: Chaos Gym
rules: This card stays in play after being played. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.

Whenever a player plays a Trainer card other than a Stadium card, he or she flips a coin. If heads, that player plays that card normally. If tails, the player can't play that card. If the card isn't put into play, the player's opponent may use that card instead, if he or she does everything required in order to play that card (like discarding cards). Either way, the card goes to its owner's discard pile.

name: Giovanni's Last Resort
rules: Remove all damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon with Giovanni in its name. Then discard your hand.

name: Lt. Surge's Secret Plan
rules: Put 1 card from your hand face down onto your Bench. (You can't play this card if your Bench is full.) Treat that card as a Basic Pokémon as long as it's face down. Flip the card if either player needs to know what it is in order to use an attack, a Pokémon Power, or a Trainer card. Flip the card if it ever uses an attack or Pokémon Power, evolves, retreats, is damaged by an attack, or is otherwise affected by an attack. At any time during your turn, you may flip the card over. When you flip that card over, if it isn't a Basic Pokémon, discard it and all cards attached to it.

name: Giovanni
rules: Choose 1 of your Pokémon in play with Giovanni in its name. For the rest of your turn, you may evolve that Pokémon even if you just played or evolved it this turn or if this is your first turn. This effect also applies to the Pokémon it evolves into.

name: Koga
rules: If an attack from a Pokémon with Koga in its name does damage to a Defending Pokémon this turn, that Pokémon is then Poisoned.

name: Misty's Wish
rules: Look at 1 of your Prize cards. Then, ask your opponent if you may switch that card with 1 of the cards in your hand. If your opponent accepts and if you have any other cards in your hand, switch those cards. If your opponent declines, return the Prize card face down and draw a card.

name: Resistance Gym
rules: This card stays in play after being played. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Each Pokémon's Resistance is reduced by 20. (If a Pokémon's Resistance is -30, it becomes -10.)

name: Sabrina
rules: Take all Energy cards attached to 1 of your Pokémon with Sabrina in its name and attach them to another 1 of your Pokémon with Sabrina in its name.

name: Blaine's Quiz #2
rules: Put a card from your hand face down in front of you. Your opponent guesses whether it is an Energy card, a Trainer card, or a Pokémon (Basic or Evolution) card. Flip the card over. If your opponent guessed right, he or she draws 2 cards. If your opponent guessed wrong, you draw 2 cards. Either way, return the card to your hand.

name: Blaine's Quiz #3
rules: Put a Basic or Evolution card from your hand face down in front of you and tell your opponent the name of an attack of that card. Your opponent guesses the name of that card. Flip the card over. If your opponent guessed right, he or she draws 3 cards. If your opponent guessed wrong, you draw 3 cards. Either way, return the card to your hand.

name: Cinnabar City Gym
rules: This card stays in play after being played. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Ignore Weakness when a Water Pokémon does damage to a Pokémon with Blaine in its name.

name: Fuchsia City Gym
rules: This card stays in play after being played. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.

Once during each player's turn (before attacking), that player may flip a coin. If heads, that player may shuffle 1 of his or her Pokémon in play with Koga in its name and any cards attached to it into his or her deck.

name: Koga's Ninja Trick
rules: Attach Koga's Ninja Trick to your Active Pokémon with Koga in its name. If this Pokémon goes to your Bench, discard this card. When your opponent attacks, you may switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon (before damage or other effects of attacks).

name: Master Ball
rules: Look at 7 cards from the top of your deck. You may choose a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card from those cards, show it to your opponent, then put it into your hand. Shuffle the rest into your deck.

name: Max Revive
rules: Discard 2 Energy cards from your hand in order to put 1 Basic Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench. (You can't play Max Revive if your Bench is full.)

name: Rocket's Minefield Gym
rules: This card stays in play after being played. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Whenever a player puts a Basic Pokémon onto his or her Bench from his or her hand, he or she flips a coin. If tails, put damage counters on that Pokémon.

name: Misty's Tears
rules: Discard 1 of the other cards in your hand in order to search your deck for up to 2 Water Energy cards. Show those cards to your opponent, then put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Saffron City Gym
rules: This card stays in play after being played. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
As often as each player like during his or her turn (before attacking), that player may return 1 basic Energy card attached to 1 of his or her Pokémon with Sabrina in its name to his or her hand.

name: Rocket's Secret Experiment
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for any card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. If tails, you can't play Trainer cards until the end of your next turn.

name: Sabrina's Psychic Control
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Trainer card in your opponent's discard pile that isn't put in play (like PlusPower or Mysterious Fossil). You may use that card as if it were in your hand, if you do everything required in order to play that card (like discarding cards). The card stays in your opponent's discard pile.

name: Fervor
rules: Show the top 3 cards of your deck to all players. Put any Fire Energy cards there into your hand and discard the rest.

name: Viridian City Gym
rules: This card stays in play after being played. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play.
Whenever a Pokémon with Giovanni in its name evolves, its owner removes 2 damage counters from that Pokémon (or 1 if it only has 1).

name: Transparent Walls
rules: Until the end of your opponent's next turn, prevent all damage from attacks done to your Benched Pokémon. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

name: Warp Point
rules: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with his or her Active Pokémon, then, if you have any Benched Pokémon, you switch 1 of them with your Active Pokémon.

name: Mew

attacks.name: Rainbow Wave
attacks.text: Choose a type of Energy other than Colorless attached to Mew. This attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon of that type (including Benched Pokémon). Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

flavorText: This Pokémon's body is covered by fine hairs that can be seen only under a microscope.

name: Pidgeot

attacks.name: Supersonic Flight
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

flavorText: This Pokémon searches for food while flying at Mach 2. Its large claws make fearsome weapons.

name: Onix

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: This Pokémon burrows through the earth at high speed, looking for food. The tunnels it digs are used by Diglett as nests.

name: Togepi

attacks.name: Bawl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: This Pokémon is still immature. When threatened, it releases poison from its head and tries to drive its enemies away.

name: Raticate

attacks.name: Sharp Teeth
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage; if tails, this attack does 10 damage.

flavorText: This Pokémon sometimes hunts for food in rivers, swimming using the small webs between the toes on its rear legs.

name: Ivysaur

attacks.name: Strange Scent
attacks.text: Each player flips a coin. Each player who gets heads chooses a total of 3 damage counters from among his or her Pokémon and removes them. (If the player's Pokémon have fewer total damage counters than that, he or she removes all of them.)

flavorText: A sure sign spring is on its way is when the seed on this Pokémon's back flowers.

name: Ledyba

attacks.name: Agility
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Ledyba.

flavorText: When it senses enemies approaching, this Pokémon releases an orange fluid from the joints in its legs and flees.

name: Butterfree

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Butterfree. If tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).

attacks.name: Rainbow Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

flavorText: The poison scales on its wings are waterproof, allowing this Pokémon to be active even on rainy days.

name: Jigglypuff

attacks.name: Tempting Eyes
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and switch it with the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

flavorText: After lulling its enemies with its large eyes, this Pokémon sings them to sleep with a relaxing melody.

name: Tentacruel

attacks.name: Tentacle Grip
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Water Energy attached to Tentacruel. For each heads, draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Poison Sting
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: This Pokémon attacks its prey with its eighty toxin-producing tentacles.

name: Lapras

attacks.name: Gentle Song
attacks.text: If Lapras has any damage counters on it, remove 2 of them from it (1 if it only has 1). If the Defending Pokémon has any damage counters on it, remove 2 of them from it (1 if it only has 1). The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

flavorText: This gentle Pokémon can understand human language and allows people to ride on its back.

name: Exeggutor

attacks.name: Sharpshooter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Grass Energy attached to Exeggutor. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

flavorText: This Pokémon has a unique cry, as all three of its heads are always talking independently of one another.

name: Slowking

attacks.name: Revelation
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

flavorText: Its nonchalant reaction to everything somehow gives this Pokémon an imposing presence.

name: Marill

attacks.name: Squirt
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

flavorText: This Pokémon's fur repels water like a duck's feathers, allowing it to stay dry and fluffy even in water.

name: Wartortle

attacks.name: Water Gun
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Wartortle but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

flavorText: When attacked, this Pokémon withdraws into its shell, although it can't quite pull in all of its long tail.

name: Lickitung

attacks.name: Lick Wounds
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 Pokémon (yours or your opponent's) with damage counters on it and remove 2 damage counters from it (1 if it only has 1).

attacks.name: Tongue Stretch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. Don't apply Weakness and Resistance.

flavorText: This Pokémon uses its six-foot tongue as if it were a hand. The origin of its anaesthetic properties is still a mystery.

name: Vileplume

attacks.name: Paradise Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 2 damage counters from Vileplume (1 if it only has 1). Then, if you have any Benched Pokémon with damage counters on them, choose 1 of them and remove 2 damage counters from it (1 if it only has 1).

attacks.name: Horrid Pollen
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

flavorText: This Pokémon makes a loud jangling noise when it shakes its petals to spread poison powder.

name: Primeape

attacks.name: Rampage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Primeape. Flip a coin. If tails, Primeape is now Confused (after doing damage).

flavorText: This Pokémon only calms down when there are no other animals or people around—which means no one has ever seen it when it's not angry.
